KH.content: mytheme, acc. Hegel, will have been a prephilosopheme promised to a dialectical Aufhebung > teleological future anterior resembles narrative while marking end of narrative fiction

FL.content: when people talk about “our time,” “our present” in the future anterior, they don’t know what they are saying > it’s precisely in this nonknowledge that the eventness of the event consists, what’s naively called its presence

S.content: Derrida reminds of Matthew Arnold, his Babelian phrase Get Geist, his claim that Geist is untranslatable > in Get Geist spirit apostrophizes itself, a beginning—no beginning (pas de commencement): in the beginning there will have been (ghost of future perfect)

POOF.content: how Nietzsche’s call to “new philosophers” asks them to come in the future & implies they have already arrived

PPHS.content: acc. Hegel, relève of space is time, time is truer than space: what space will have meant is time [future anterior], sensory intuition of sign relevé in passage of time

SH.content: date is a future anterior, the slightest indetermination increases the chances (of a future anterior), gives time one assigns to anniversaries to come

DS.content: mimēsis imitates a mnēmē (a past present) > “hope,” anamnesis (future as past present due to return), the preface, the anterior future (future perfect) arrange things

ROP.content: future anterior and conditional concerns archivization, what remains or does not remain

O.content: teleological anticipation: soothing order of future perfect

IW.content: future anterior: can lead to retrospective distortions, can also tear down veils

D.content: double bottom, “theaters of memory,” deprives square of ground (suspended in air)
such future perfect makes one text circulate in another, excludes eschatology > future perfect of innumerable imperfect, indefinite past that will never have been present
imperfect, certain aorist, certain unlimitedness, “unreachable double bottom (double-fond insaisissable)”: past of an anterior future, future of an anterior past

C.content: paradigm most often designates an artificial model that already proceeds from a technē: artifact constructed in the past anterior > fac-simile origin of future anterior of model

ATM.content: the future anteriority of Levinas’ seriasure [each interruption will be knotted w/ another] is an eschatology w/out [beyond/otherwise than] philosophical teleology, appealing to a past anterior to any past; this future anteriority is irreducible to ontology or Hegelian teleology [in spite of irreducible resemblance]
